column4: i read the solution to my anjuta problem is: "Change the /bin/sh symlink on Ubuntu systems to point to the dash shell instead of the current bash shell. "   how do i do that??????
that's not the solution.
so what is the solution?
What's the problem? Sounds like your script is written wrong.
i didn't write anything yet, it's just a fresh copy of anjuta, and i get the message: "/usr/bin/create_global_tags.sh: 3: function: not found  shift: 11: can't shift that many."
i googled on it and it told me to do what i wrote in the channel before
the problem is it's using bash, and you want it to use dash?  Are you sure that's not backwards?
to tell you the truth i'm new in the linux thingy and i have no idea what's the difference, i think that dash is a more powerfull shell?
With edgy, ubuntu switched to using dash as default, which broke a *lot* of scripts which required stuff in bash (and didn't specify that they needed bash, because the writers were careless)
the shebang at the beginning of the script (#! /bin/sh) says "use any shell", they needed /bin/bash, essentially.
so where is this script located? in usr/bin?
Uh, that script was... whereever that error message said it was.  But, first, are you sure you're installing the correct version of anjuita?  Made for Edgy?
I used the simple add/remove thingy of edgy and put a mark next to anjuta...
hmm.  Really?  They still haven't fixed a bug like that this far along?  You're running from the... oh, a bug report
right.  Ok, so we're going to open to that file, (sudo nano /usr/bin/create_global_tags.sh) and change the first line, where it says /bin/sh, change it to /bin/bash
I got anjuta 2.0.2
thanks, looks ok now
lol, now anjuta crashed (it worked almost fine before), checking what's wrong...
You're connected to the internet, right?
and have updated all these packages?
yes, ofcourse
Odd.  Just strikes me as horribly odd that something so simple hasn't yet been fixed in the repos.
i might have damaged something yesterday when i wasn't able to connect to my access-point that has wpa-psk, and i had to install network-manager menually,
ok now i still get a weird message when i try to execute my prog, "program <program path> is not a local file"
